description: Add Only Flag.  Indicates that the service is an add only, not an update.

RecallObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

RecallObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

RecallObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

description: Reference to an existing recall for update-only purposes.

Financials_Business_Process_Parameters.description: When set to "true" or "1", the business process is automatically processed. This means that all approvals will be automatically approved in the system, all reviews and to-do's will be automatically by-passed, and all notifications will be automatically suppressed.

Business_Process_Comment_Data.description: Free form comment regarding the business process.

validation.validation: This Business Process has been configured to disable comment. Please remove the comment or change the setting in the Business Process Policy or tenant setup.

WorkerObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Business_Process_Comment_Data.description: Default the Person making the comment to the processing person if not submitted via the web service.

Financials_Business_Process_Parameters.description: Captures the Comment for the Business Process.

description: Business Process Parameters provide the ability to auto-submit to the business process.

validation.validation: Duplicate entries found for the same Recall Line. Please remove the duplicate(s).
Transaction Date Range On or After must be earlier than Transaction Date Range On or Before
A value is required for Transaction Date Range On Or Before or Transaction Range On or After.
You have recall lines with the same item. Please select a different item on one of your lines. The following items are in use: ([existingItems]).
Select an active recall severity. [severity] is inactive.
Select an active recall category. [category] is inactive.

You have recall lines with the same manufacturer part ID that matches only one item. Please select a different manufacturer part ID on one of your lines.  Duplicate manufacturer part IDs: [manufacturerPartIDs]
Select an active recall source. [source] is inactive.
